data.title: Cincinnati Zoo & Botanical Garden
data.text:
PNC Festival of Lights

The Cincinnati Zoo is shining bright for the 42nd annual PNC Festival of Lights! Come early to see more animals and stay for the lights!

In addition to admiring the beauty of 4 million LED lights, visitors can find the 5 Fiona fairies in Fairyland, take in a blacklight puppet show, marvel at the spectacular Wild Lights on Swan Lake, or snack at one of our seasonal concessions.

DetailsWhat to ExpectSanta's VillageMadCapNorth Polar ExpressScavenger HuntHappy Zoo Year

November 21, 2024 – January 5, 2025

Zoo Hours during PNC Festival of Lights:

Sunday – Thursday: 10am – 9pm

Friday – Saturday: 10am – 10pm

The Zoo is closed on Thanksgiving (November 28th), Christmas Eve (December 24th), and Christmas Day (December 25th).

PNC Festival of Lights is included in Zoo admission. Visit the Zoo early and stay for the lights!

North Polar Express train & Conservation Carousel rides begin at 2:30pm

Dec. 23rd is the last night to visit with Santa

Full costumed characters may not be allowed in the Zoo.

Wonder at the 4 million LED lights throughout the Zoo

Santa & Mrs. Claus & All other character visits begin at 4pm

Families will enjoy searching for Fiona fairy statues in Fiona’s Fairyland

Guests will enjoy the immersive “Under the Sea” area.

Over 50 larger than life Animal Lanterns located throughout the Zoo

Wild Lights Show on Swan Lake

The Wild Lights Show at Swan Lake will have a strobing light effect. This show could be disruptive to those with sensitivity to light or those who have epilepsy.

Meet costume characters beginning at 4pm

Please note that adult guests in full character costumes, such as Santa suits, Grinch costumes, etc may not be admitted into the Zoo

Ride the North Polar Express Train and Conservation Carousel rides start daily at 2:30pm (additional charges apply)

Roast Smore’s at the Smore’s Stations

Enjoy freshly roasted nuts and other holiday treats

See animals inside multiple indoor heated buildings

Meet-A-Creature: meet ambassador animals at Manatee Springs, Discovery Forest, and Club House

Happy Zoo Year celebration on Dec 31

Share your PNC Festival of Lights pictures on social media using #cincyzoopic for a chance to be featured in future Zoo marketing material!

Santa’s Village

Visit with Santa in Santa’s Village nightly at 4pm through December 23!

Sensory Santa

Sensory-Friendly Santa 2024 dates will be announced soon!

The Cincinnati Zoo & Botanical Garden’s Zoo Access for All program is designed to encourage families and individuals of all backgrounds to visit our world-class organization to build lifelong and multi-generational memories.

PNC Festival of Lights Social Narrative

Sensory Santa Social Narrative

Sensory Santa Sponsored by:

Don’t miss nightly performances of this black light puppet show at 6:30pm, 7:30pm, and 8:30pm at the Amphitheater.

Sponsored by:

The North Polar Express Train will be equipped with a longer-than-ever light tunnel to make your ride extra bright! North Polar Express train ride and begins at 2:30pm. (Additional charges apply for non-members)

Sponsored by:

Guests are invited to ring in the New Year at the Cincinnati Zoo & Botanical Garden. “Party Animals” of all ages invited to celebrate the 15th annual Happy ZOO Year. This New Years bash will take place at the Zoo on Tuesday, December 31.

Event info

Powered by Arlinghaus Plumbing Heating & Air Conditioning

Visit Early to See Animals

To avoid crowds, we recommend visiting weeknights!

PNC Festival of Lights is all about… the LIGHTS! Our Zoo animals usually head indoors around 5pm or sooner so make sure to come early and stay for the lights if you’re hoping to see animals!

Meet-A-Creature: meet ambassador animals at Manatee Springs, Discovery Forest, and Club House

Buildings that will be open during PNC Festival of Lights: Reptile House, Gorilla World, Night Hunters, Dragons, World of the Insect, Manatee Springs, Jungle Trails West, Discovery Forest

Buildings that will close during PNC Fesitval of Lights: Wings of the World, Jungle Trails East

Goat contact yard closes at 6:30pm but goats may be viewable

See more details about what is going on during your Zoo visit*.

*weather permitting

Dress for Cold Weather & Bring a Blanket

Dress warm! You can always shed a layer!

Know How to Get to the Zoo

Our parking lot address is: 3427 Vine Street

Our street address is: 3400 Vine Street Cincinnati, OH 45220. Directions >

Memberships make Great Gifts

Give the gift that keeps giving! Renew, purchase or gift a membership! The holidays are a peak time for membership gifts and renewals!

Join the Zoo Family
